page.title: 14DERBYSHIRE HILL FARMING 2.
page.content: On one local Derbyshire farm, several cross-bred cows are kept in the long shippon next to the farmhouse during the winter months. They calve in May or June and are then turned out with their calves. Heifer calves stay as replacements in the herd; bull calves will be kept until the September sales of their first or second year. During May and June, the shippons are thoroughly cleaned out and the muck spread and harrowed onto the hay meadows. Routine farm work like thistle cutting, walling and fencing all have to be finished before hay-making in July or August. Straw and corn are bought in for the cattle during the winter months. A milking cow is also kept for domestic use. See PAGE 13 for other farm activities.
